hots.title: Quote issues (reply)
hots.content:
[{"attributes":{"background":"transparent"},"insert":"Fireb0mb1—"},{"attributes":{"header":3},"insert":"

"},{"attributes":{"background":"transparent"},"insert":"gm "},{"attributes":{"background":"transparent"},"insert":{"mention":{"index":"0","denotationChar":"@","id":"7003","value":"Yao","target":"u"}}},{"attributes":{"background":"transparent"},"insert":" , when I use the "Reply" button on a comment I want to answer to and then I try to start a quote for something else in the same message using the quote button from the toolbar (say I was going to quote a text from our Governance rules to point something out), it doesn't let me and just adds the whole text of the current topic in a quote at the top. It might be related to the other bug of quotes always being added at the top of the message instead of adding them where the cursor currently is in the message when I click the "Quote" contextual menu. Could you take a look at these issues please?"},{"attributes":{"list":"ordered"},"insert":"



"},{"attributes":{"alt":" "},"insert":{"image":"https://cdn.discordapp.com/avatars/205774649232064512/2d8aaac29b1300f2fc81b2a4b0ccfedf.webp?size=80"}},{"attributes":{"background":"transparent"},"insert":"Fireb0mb1—"},{"attributes":{"header":3},"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"background":"transparent"},"insert":"Today at 8:18 AM"},{"attributes":{"header":3},"insert":"
"},{"attributes":{"background":"transparent"},"insert":"There's also a behavior that makes it hard to get out of a quote, if you're on the last line of a quote and press enter it creates a new line for the quote, and I still haven't found a way to go back to non-quote, usually if you use backspace on an empty quote line it puts you back, but here neither Backspace, nor the quote button from the tooldbar lets you do this "},{"attributes":{"alt":"🤔"},"insert":{"image":"https://discord.com/assets/263a7f4eeb6f69e46d969fa479188592.svg"}},{"attributes":{"list":"ordered"},"insert":"
